alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 26 at 6:37AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Windy With Blowing Snow Over Summits Tonight Into Tuesday... ...Chance of Freezing Rain Tonight And Monday... A weather front approaching from the west tonight will bring snow and blowing snow to the Summits of the Steese and Elliott Highways tonight through Tuesday. Summits could get up to 4 inches of snow. Summits could have west widns of 20 to 30 mph. There will be a chance of freezing rain tonight and Monday along the Steese, Elliot, Richardson and Parks Highways, and in Fairbanks as well. Any freezing rain that falls is expected to be less than one tenth of an inch, but could make roads very slippery Snow is expected to move south into Fairbanks and Denali on Monday and continue into Tuesday. Up to 4 inches of snow is possible in Fairbanks from Monday into Tuesday.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands
